item.title: Employment | Leong Sun Iok warns of collecting candidate information
item.description:
Leong Sun IOK warns of the increase of companies that research the past of job candidates and argues that the information obtained by former employers is often skewed and unfair. The deputy calls for regulation to the government
Deputy Leong Sun IOK intends that the government regulates the collection of information carried out by companies about job candidates. The request is contained in a written interpellation, in which the legislator linked to the Federation of Macao Workers Associations (Faom) warns of the occurrence of various illegalities, without any consequences. According to the scenario outlined by Leong Sun Iok, when applying for a job, especially through online platforms, interested parties are led to sign forms and to consent that entities research their past. However, the deputy warns that the practice is illegitimate, uncommon, allowing the creation of informal black lists and the exchange of information between companies. This situation can result in the blocking of job opportunities for former employees who have had different employer entities. "It is a practice that blocks access to employment in an industry, which seriously undermines the right to employment," says the legislator. Leong Sun Iok also reveals that “over the years he has received a high number of requests and assistance” from people faced from one of the six game dealers and that they have later seen themselves. "Some people who asked me for help told me that they were convinced by supervisors to say goodbye. And if they did not say goodbye to their initiative, they were threatened that they would never find employment in the industry again. All these cases reflect the damage caused by collecting information without any regulation," added the deputy. However, the practice is not limited to this sector: "In addition to the game dealers, there are a high number of companies in Macao that also requires employment candidates to allow their past to be investigated," he said. Against the law Leong Sun IOK also points out that the Labor Relations Law and Decree-Law 101/84/M define that former expirers when issuing a proof of work to a former worker cannot make any unfavorable reference to its past. However, the deputy indicates that the current, even informal practice, contradicts the spirit of the law, ending up being more harmful, because the former employee has no control over information that may not even be true. "As the verification process lacks transparency and is not controlled by the Directorate of Services for Labor Affairs, it is unfair to employment candidates and can violate the principle of good faith in labor relations," he warns. "How will management regulate information about professional background? It is possible to issue guidelines and change the law to explicitly stipulate that former employers should in no way transmit, make statements or adopt unfavorable behaviors to workers?"

item.title: Elections | PS again denounces alleged ATFPM practices
item.description:
The Macao Public Service Association is again accused by the Socialist Party to commit illegalities in the context of the vote of local voters for the next legislative elections in Portugal. Rita Santos and José Pereira Coutinho, from ATFPM, deny everything
The prosecution is not new: the Macao Public Function Workers Association (ATFPM) was the subject of a complaint made by the Socialist Party (PS) to the National Elections Commission (CNE) in Portugal, for making “actions that compromise the freedom and confidentiality of vote” of local voters for May 18, in Portugal, which will serve a new parliament and first minister. According to the PS complaint sent to the CNE, which includes photos of the alleged illegalities, "the presence of individuals who identify themselves as" volunteers "at the door of a Macao Post station, addressing voters to indicate where they should vote." Thus, “this is the same practice that occurred in the last legislative elections that took place in 2024 and it was found to be conducted by Rita Santos, a prominent figure of ATFPM and advisor to the Portuguese communities”. Rita Santos, however, stopped being a counselor. The images attached to the complaint show "one of the volunteers at the Macao postal door, addressing voters", and "in some cases requests the delivery of voting bulletins," a practice that suggests "directing the vote and calling into question the fundamental principles of a democratic electoral process." Scenario of “impunity” HM confronted Rita Santos and José Pereira Coutinho, president of ATFPM, with this complaint, both denied the accusations. "We are unaware of the situation of volunteers referring because ATFPM is not involved or interferes with the elections of the Assembly of the Republic of Portugal. This year are the elections of the Legislative Assembly (AL) of Macao and we are committed to the presentation of the candidacy of the Nova Esperança list," said Rita Santos. Pereira Coutinho, also deputy to Al, said “unaware of” the accusation. "ATFPM has no one to do this, they are inventions to which we are alien," he said. It is recalled that the last complaint submitted by the PS to the CNE was then sent to the prosecutor in Portugal. The investigation still takes place and is in secret of justice, as already reported, and no accusation has not yet been deducted. Already in 2019, the PS had submitted a similar complaint. The PS understands that "the constant action of the association in the electoral context raises concerns about the possible misuse of resources to influence the voting process", in the case of "recurring practices in potundous legislative elections". "The persistence of such behaviors, coupled with apparent impunity, aggravates the severity of the facts and requires, once and for all, a firm response from the competent authorities," the PS.

item.title: AFA | “Déjà Vu” presents works in the area of ​​Video-Arte
item.description:
Integrated in the poster of this year's edition of the French May festival, here is the new exhibition of the local AFA - Art for All Society Association. This is “Déjà VU-an exhibition of Sino-Francês artistic exchange”, where the themes of video art and artificial intelligence resonate from the signing works of Robert Cahen, Alice Kok and Catherine Cheong. To see in The Parisian between May 15 and June 28
Video art, mixed with the real and the fictional, artificial and created with human hands. It is around these ideas and concepts that revolves the new exhibition of AFA-Art for All Society, entitled “Dejá Vu-an exhibition of sino-francês artistic exchange”, and which gains the subtitle “Mirroring ・ Loging ・ Generatting”: from video art to artificial intelligence-exhibition series ”. The project, patent between May 15 and June 28 in one of the galleries of The Parisian venture in Cotai, presents to the public works of three artists: Alice Kok, co-founder of AFA, artist and curator; Robert Cahen and Catherine Cheong. The project is integrated in this year's edition poster of the French May festival, which brings Hong Kong a series of cultural initiatives. According to a statement from AFA, “Déjà vu” aims to establish “a bridge between the Sino-Franceses cultural dialogues through art”, also promoting the investigation into “the philosophical intersections of time, memory and perception”. In addition to the presence in Macao, this show will be evident in France, between 21 and 30 August, at the Espace Temps Gallery in Paris. Thus, the “cultural exchange” is promoted between China and France, highlights AFA, and the public is invited to “witness the evolution of interaction between memory and technology”. “Déjà vu”, theory developed by the French philosopher Henri Bergson, gives the motto to this show, revealing “the simultaneous division between perception and memory”, that is, “the coexistence between the present 'current' and its 'virtual' image in the mirror”. The works of the three artists thus exploit this abstract philosophical concept, transforming it into “tangible sensory experiences through video art, images generated by artificial intelligence and multimedia facilities”. The show, which has the keywords “Mirroring”, “looping” and “Generation”, referring to the ideas of mirror, repetition or content generation, reflects “not only the artists techniques, but also metaphorizes the way memory and technology weave the invisible tissue of contemporary reality”. Initial Workshop In addition to the show itself, artists will also join to teach others about the world of digital and video art. Robert Cahen, considered one of the pioneers in Video Art in France, collaborates with Alice Kok for the “Video Postcards” workshop, held on May 18 The Parisian Macau. The idea is to lead participants to “dive into Coloane's natural and historical landscapes, inspired by the poetics of fleeting images', characteristic of Cahen's work”. Thus, “through techniques such as slow chamber, overlap and sound design, participants will transform ephemeral sensory experiences into unique '' postcards,” describes AFA, and experience includes filming, post-production context and final projection. Who is who Robert Cahen has been developing artistic projects since 1972. According to the official program of the French May festival, in Cahen's work “both fiction and documentation are presented as metaphorical trips of the imaginary, exquisite daydreams that describe passages of time, place, memory and perception”. Having started with the video cassettes, his works were exposed worldwide, in places and events such as the Paris Biennial, France; The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA), New York, USA; or the American Film Institute National Video Festival, Los Angeles, USA. In 1992 the artist won the Villa Medicis Hors Les Murs award and, in 1995, created a permanent video installation for Euralille (Lille) public space in France. In the case of Catherine Cheong, she is a local artist who lives between Macau and Paris, having graduated in the area of ​​video installation at the Visual Arts Degree at École Supérieure D'Art et de Design Toulon. item.title: Shanghai | Legoland will open in July largest theme park in the world
item.description: The Danish brand Lego, which specializes in building blocks, will open on July 5 its largest theme park in the world in Shanghai, east of China, the local press advanced yesterday. The complex, about 52 kilometers southwest of the city center, will feature more than 75 attractions and shows distributed by eight distinct zones, including thousands of figures built with about 85 million lego pieces. Visitors will also be able to watch Lego movies in a 4D movie theater as well as lodge in a 250-room themed hotel, decorated according to five different environments inspired by this universe of recognized toy on the global scale. Currently, the park is in the final phase of construction: the main entrance is completed and the main 24 attractions are practically ready. About a thousand employees will integrate the team since the opening. The highlight of the park will be the “Miniland” zone, a recreation, built fully with Lego blocks - with a total weight of 45 tons - some of Shanghai's most emblematic areas, as well as other China's cultural and tourist icons. Among the expected shows, stands out the world's first show dedicated to Lego's “Monkie Kid” series, inspired by King Macaco, from the classic Chinese work Journey to the West. Legoland Shanghai has already started selling season passes and tickets for exclusive visits, including stays at the themed hotel. "We know this market well and we are enthusiastic about its potential. This complex will be a reference and meeting point for all Lego fans in China," said Fiona Eastwood, executive director of Merlin Entertainments, the British group responsible for managing Legoland parks. According to the company, more than 55 million people live two hours - or less - by car the location of the new park.

item.title: MGM Resorts International warns bets in Japan and Thailand
item.description: A Casinos operator in Macau said yesterday that the opening of casinos in Japan and the potential legalization of the game in Thailand will increase competition with regard to Asian gamblers. The director for the global development of the US company MGM Resorts International, which operates two casinos in Macao, said the new game concessions accelerated the transition from a model based on major gamblers to “a more diverse tourism and entertainment economy”. The six Macao game operators signed 10-year concession agreements in December 2022, committing to invest 108.7 billion in tourism and the diversification of the economy. “The reinforcement of cultural attractions, from entertainment to families (…) helped attract more vast demographics than traditional gamblers,” said Ed Bowers. But the executive warned that "competition is intensifying in Asian markets, particularly with Japan and potentially Thailand." MGM started on April 24 with the construction of the first integrated venture with a Japan casino in Osaka, scheduled for 2030. The Thailand government presented a proposal to legalize the game. "This is excellent news for staff of the development of casinos like me," said Bowers, who recalled that Thailand "already benefits from a strong tourist infrastructure." But the discussion of the proposal in Parliament was postponed in early April, "probably due to the increase in political opposition" to the idea, admitted the executive. Other bets Bowers spoke during the Global Gaming Expo Asia, the largest event in the game industry held in Macau, which will take place until Friday. In another session of the same event, experts argued that, given the greater regional competition, the bet on game -related attractions, such as concerts, themed parks and gastronomy can bring more people to the casinos. “We built all this to support our casino, the casino is our financial engine,” said Wade Howk, director of operations at Inspire Entertainment Resort, an integrated resort in South Korea, with an exclusive casino for foreigners. The session focused on the diversification of the economy of Macao, where taxes on casinos represented 88.4 percent of the region's current current revenues in the first three months of the year. But the authorities intend that the sector not related to the game represent 60 percent of Macao Gross Domestic Product by 2028. As an example, Wade Howk stressed that Inspire Entertainment built a 15,000 -seat entertainment space, the only multipurpose cultural arena in South Korea to increase the number of visitors. "We are seeing huge results with this now, and then we built a covered water park ... just to make sure we could boost traffic to support the entire property, ... and that it could be used to support the casino," Howk explained. Jeffrey Kiang, an investment group analyst CSSA, stressed that game -related components should “create synergies and complement the business” of casinos. Kiang has observed an increase in the number of concerts held in Macao in the last two years and said that the casino operators carefully select events or artists who attract gamblers.

item.description: Indian Foreign Minister warned yesterday that a new attack on Pakistan will provoke a “very strong response” from India, a day after the most violent military confrontation of the last two decades between the two countries. "It is not our intention to provoke a new climb" of the conflict, said Subrahmanyam Jaishankar, at the opening of a meeting with the Iranian counterpart, Abbas Araghchi. "But if we are attacked, there is no doubt that we will respond very firmly," he said. The threat is done a day after Pakistan has guaranteed that it will take revenge on the dead caused by Indian air strikes that, according to Nova Delhi, were an response to an attack on Caxemira. "We are committed to avenge every drop of blood from these martyrs," said Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif, in a nation speech on Wednesday night. Growing Over the past two weeks, the tension between India and Pakistan has grown, following an attack on April 22 in Pahalgam, a tourist town in the Indian part of the disputed region of Caxemira, in which 26 people died. India accused Pakistan of supporting the extremist group that liable for the attack, an accusation that Islamabade vehemently denied. After several diplomatic measures and a series of incidents along the border that separates the two countries in Caxemira, Nova Deli launched attacks on three Pakistan areas, which, according to the Indian government, constituted “terrorist places” in Punjab province. A few hours later, the Pakistani government announced that it has slaughtered several Indian military aircraft and, on Wednesday morning, a sequence of Islamabade bombing and Nova Delhi caused at least 38 dead in the biggest confrontation in the last 20 years. Yesterday, India announced that 13 civilians died and 59 were injured in Caxemira in retaliation for the Pakistani attack released on Wednesday over its territory and Pakistan said it slaughtered an Indian drone in Lahore. Iran offered to mediate the conflict between the two nuclear powers, and the minister responsible for the diplomacy of Tehran reunited with those responsible of the Pakistani government on Monday. Upon arrival in India, Abbas Araghchi admitted that he expects "the parties to have moderation to avoid climbing tensions in the region." Iran maintains good relations with India and Pakistan, with which it borders.

Nothing like the other's knowledge to bring and dispel prejudice, being one of the most usual that Chinese are extremely pragmatic and cold. But when we come across proverbs such as “love others as yourself,” in a direct translation and faithful to the original “爱人如己” (ài Rú Rú Jǐ), such leads us to think twice, it seems not to be here just a matter of respect, uncharged and formal, but rather a strong feeling for the other, not any, only a deep affection, of those we understand well that we are good, we will be well, we will be well, we will be well, we will be better. After all, selfishness may not be a dominant tendency, there is everything: selfish, aggressive and competitive people, as others will be naturally altruistic, compassionate and cooperatives, ready to recognize the universality of the feeling of love, which crosses borders rather than erecting them, bringing people closer to the most diverse social classes, ethnic groups, geographies, as in "love has no borders", in a direct translation "" (Àiqíng wú jiējí zhī fēn), here is particularly emphasized social borders. The content of the message gains full sense when one realizes that love to oneself takes place in a culture that many consider wrong and prejudiced only to focus on the whole, in the community. Attention to the person, the particular and the style and feeling of each, lives, in philosophies such as Taoist for centuries with the valorization of the collectivity, this ultimate tendency manifestly inculcated and worked by Confucianism. Love to itself, care for the individual body and mind, is emphasized in the so -called Proverbial “well -understood love and virtue must begin with us”, which has the following correspondence in Chinese “爱德从己起” (to Cong Jǐ qǐ). Anyone who imagines that in proverbial wisdom there is only place to praise and sing relational love, since the Chinese have no religious philosophy that chant spiritual love above all, in the Christian way of St. Augustine, will be surprised to find the following proverb "where there is no other gentleman", that in a direct translation of the Chinese is "the love above all" 爱情至上 爱情至上 爱情至上ZHì Shàng). If in doubt, there is another saying of complementary meaning and in which the idea of ​​the integrity and unity of this powerful affection, which moves mountains in the Christian sense, when it reads 爱情专一 （（（（iqíng zhuān yī）, in a possible translation "love cannot be broken", "one person cannot have a heart in two parts at the same time." From a psychological point of view, the acceptance of the other in loving terms will have to be complete, so their tastes, affections, relationships, and objects cannot be rejected, as it follows from the lesson “Who loves Beltrão, loves his dog”, in a relative correspondence for “爱屋及乌” (ài wū jí wū), which in a literal translation would be “love the house and the crows”. As is well known, proverbs are susceptible to various interpretations, so they say polysemic, but if they are perspective as a whole, and only then as pieces of a puzzle, there seems to be many doubts with regard to the proverb philosophy and psychology of Chinese love, which is echoed in the country's scholarly philosophies. In Chapter 67 of the Book of the road and virtue (《道德经》), also known by the name of the Patriarch of Taoism, Lazi (老子), is the first of the three guiding virtues of the Wise Way, love, as you can read in the translation of Claudia Ribeiro (2004, 139): I have three treasures What entesouro and retains: The first is love (CI), The second frugality, The third is not daring to be the vanguard of the world. The sky will come to aid And, with love, will protect (我有三寶/寶而持之/一曰慈/二曰儉/三曰不敢為天下先 (……) 夫慈以戰則勝//以守則固/以慈衛之 1) It is noted that while in proverbial philosophy the synogram used for love is 爱/愛 2 (AI), in the scholarly philosophy of the Patriarch of Taoism the term employment is 慈 (CI), that is, love with a strong relational and spiritual burden; Although they are different words, both refer to love, the first concerns the most physical and concrete feeling, centered on the heart of the person and the clutches that hold it; The second to that most relational and general indicates that love comes from inside the heart (内心 nèixīn), where it has the roots, emerging like any plant. Hugo Schuchardt's interest in Luso-Asian Creole has been studied by Hugo Cardoso, a researcher and professor at the Faculty of Letters of the University of Lisbon (FLUL), a Creole specialist who developed investigation at the University of Macao. The academic recently conducted a lecture at the National Library in Lisbon over the linguist born in Gotha, Germany, in 1842 and died in Graz, Austria, in 1927, being considered one of the most important linguists of the late nineteenth and early twentieth century. The session was called “Hugo Schuchardt and the search for the Luso-Asian Creole”. Despite Schuchardt's interest on Macao's Creole, he did not publish any academic work on the subject, as he told HM Hugo Cardoso. "Schuchardt did not publish any work on Macau. However, when he covered his correspondence, it is clear that Macau was also on his radar, since he discusses the Macao Creole with several of his correspondents, including Vasconcelos milk and Gonçalves Viana," he said. After the German linguist, Hugo Cardoso highlights, “there were actually several people who leaned over Macau Creole, including Danilo Barreiros, José dos Santos Ferreira (Adé), Graciete Batalha, Ana Maria Amaro and, more recently, Prof. Raúl Gaião and Prof. Mário Pinharanda Nunes”. For the professor at FLUL, pioneering in the study of the Creoles is an expression that rhymes with Schuchardt. The German linguist was "absolutely pioneering in this domain, not only in the study of the Luso-Sasitive Creole or even the Portuguese Lexical Base Creoles globally, but in the study of Creole languages ​​in general" and, for this reason, is "a larger figure in the history of linguistics." Hugo Cardoso also points out that "as regards the Portuguese lexical base creoles, before him, there had been some activity, especially by Adolfo Coelho, who, in 1881, had published" Romanesque or Neo-Latin dialects in Africa, Asia and America, "in which he was a caught in various Portuguese-based Creole." However, in this work, Adolfo Coelho refers only to three Luso-Asiatic Creole: “Ceylon's (at Sri Lanka), Malaca and Macau's-giving some examples that he could get from previous publications (such as Macau's Ta-Ss-Yang-Kuo magazine)”. The academic has no doubt that “Hugo Schuchardt was surely inspired by Rabbit's work, but his efforts to obtain primary data from many other Asian places greatly expanded cartography of the Luso-sinical Creole and resulted in the first published news and the first grammatical descriptions of many of them (such as Diu, Cananor, Mahé, Mangar, Mangar, Mangar etc.) ”. "One effect of his work was to inspire other agents to develop similar work: there stands out the figure of Sebastião Rodolfo Dalgado, who led his own research and made his own publications about the Indo-Portuguese Creoles that Schuchardt had not approached, about Damão, Bombaim, Ceylon and Negapath." In the case of José de Leite Vasconcelos, who wrote the letter cited at the beginning of this text, "it also corresponded with Schuchardt and reveals, in his linguistic studies, the impact of Schuchardt's work." Asked by HM about the possible interconnections between the Creole of IUD, Batávia and Macao, Hugo Cardoso states that there are "continuities between the various Luso-Asian Creole, but also many differences." item.title: Blackout | Normality resumed yesterday, it still causes because it
item.description:
The week has started atypically on the Iberian Peninsula. It was a few minutes from 11:30 am on Monday, when a widespread electricity failure paralyzed Portugal and Spain. Only near 23h the light returned to the Portuguese house, but the dropper
It was an apparent normal Monday, but this normality was dissipated late in the morning with the electricity failure that gradually led to communication failures and impossibility of using mobile data. Portugal and Spain were without electricity for too many hours on Monday, an unprecedented episode in terms of energy failures. In the case of Lisbon, the light began to fail a few minutes after 11:30 am, followed by the impossibility of communication via mobile data. Traffic in the center of the Portuguese capital became chaotic, without traffic lights in operation, generating some road accidents. Supermarkets, cafes and restaurants, with no possibility of maintaining normal operation and food properly refrigerated, closed doors. Many people, frightened by the possibility of staying several days without light, ran to supermarkets, sagging canned foods, water carboys, candles and batteries. In addition to the unusual constraints in people's daily lives, with the suddenly closed meter and congested transport, there were suspended flights and closed airports. The restoration of energy took place gradually throughout Monday, starting with the Center of Portugal. The circulation in the Lisbon Metropolitan (ML) was resumed at all at 08:38, Lisbon time, first in the blue and red lines at 08h, in yellow at 08:15 and green at 08:38. "The Lisbon Metropolitano had a vast team working yesterday evening [Monday] and today's dawn [Tuesday] to ensure the replacement of operating systems affected by the widespread energy failure yesterday," the ML said in a statement. Government words In a note issued by the Portuguese government in the early hours of yesterday morning, it was said that there were already “virtually all services, including the supply of energy, restored,” Presidential Minister António Leitão Amaro told Lusa. According to the minister, all 6.4 million customers had access to electricity in the early hours of Tuesday morning, except 800 who had faults not related to the blackout. Leitão Amaro also said that water supply is working throughout the country, with only a few pressure difficulties in "two or three municipalities" that will be "resolved quickly". Regarding transportation, the minister said that the "trains are working", and it is still necessary to stabilize some points of the operation, but due to the effects of 24 hours strike that took place on Monday. About airports, “are operational,” said Leitão Amaro, recognizing that in the case of Lisbon airport, which was the most affected by energy failure and should take two days [to this day] to have stabilized flows, although the systems are all operational. Normalized Schools and Health The Portuguese ruler also said that, in relation to schools, the orientation issued at dawn to all directors was to open and function normally, except for cases where there may be some specific security ratio. "The supply of fuels is normalized and did not record, at night, relevant occurrences of security or civil protection" in the country, advanced Leitão Amaro, stressing that the situation is also stabilized in health services. "Hospitals and health centers are in terms of supply and supply to function normally," he said. "Right now, what we can say is that [energy] systems are stabilized, both in transportation and consumers supply," said the presidency minister. In Spain there were also several embarrassment, especially at the level of transport. Pedro Sánchez, Spanish Prime Minister, said on Monday, quoted by Lusa, that this episode was unprecedented in the country. The ruler spoke to the country after the second meeting of Spain National Security Council. "All potential causes are analyzed without discarding any hypothesis," he added. Gigawatts loss The Spanish government leader revealed that, according to the technicians and experts of the Spanish power grid, 15 generation gigawatts "suddenly lost the system in just five seconds, something that had never happened." According to explained, to give a dimension of the event, 15 kilowatts of generation correspond to approximately looking for total electricity in the country at the time of blackout (12:33 in Spain, 11h33 in Lisbon). "What has caused this sudden disappearance of supply" is something that experts cannot yet explain, he added. In the early hours after the blackout, information began to circulate on a possible cyberathel who never confirmed. A few hours after the blackout, Ursula Von der Leyen, president of the European Commission, said on Linkedin's social network that he had spoken with the prime ministers Pedro Sánchez and Luís Montenegro about the monitoring of the case. “I reaffirmed that the European Commission has supported and monitored the situation with national and European authorities and together with our electricity coordination group. We will gather efforts and share information to help restore the electricity supply system, agreeing to maintain narrow contact,” reads one of the publications. Eduardo Prieto, head of operations at Spanish Red Electric, told the Associated Press that the situation was not preceded by something “exceptional and extraordinary”. One of the possible causes pointed to the blackout is a rare atmospheric phenomenon, referred to as “induced atmospheric vibration”, which may have originated “anomalous oscillations” in the high voltage lines of the Spanish energy network. "These oscillations have caused synchronization failures between electrical systems, leading to successive disturbances in interconnected European networks," the Portuguese Energy company Ren to BBC told Monday afternoon. But later Ren denied this information. Many issues Another causes may have been technical problems in the electric network itself. Onyema NDUKA, a full -sustainability professor of energy sustainability at the University of London, said electric networks are usually interconnected because the production centers that feed them are located far from cities. This means that a power cut in a part of the grid can "lead to a waterfall effect in other areas." "Ideally, redundancies are incorporated into the system, such as having several supply points, reserve generators located in different locations, wires and interconnected cables, etc.," he said. The solution is through energy companies to restore electricity to affected customers as soon as possible, but the procedure for doing so “has not yet been revealed,” added NDUKA. The Portuguese authorities, cited by the AP and the local media, have so far attributed the failure of energy to unspecified technical problems, originating outside the country, but mentioned that the investigation is still underway. The possibility of a cyberatoque is, for now, away. “Spain has mechanisms to deal with this kind of situations. Once again, I appeal to citizens to collaborate with all authorities and act responsibly and civilly, as we have always done,” wrote Pedro Sánchez on social networks. The Portuguese National Cyberrseness Center also stated in a statement that there is no evidence that the failure was caused by a computer attack. Speaking to Euronews, Taco Engelaar, Neara Director-General, a specialist in energy infrastructure, said the interconnectivity of national networks and their systems would mean that a failure or attack would have the same net result. "Such a widespread failure of the network is extremely unusual and can be caused by a number of factors: a physical failure on the network that provokes the power cut, a coordinated cybercar or a dramatic imbalance between demand and the supply that has made the network system exceeds the boundaries," he said. "If it is a system failure, then the interconnectivity between the different regional and national networks can lead to the large amount of power cuts we are watching today [Monday]," he added. "The same applies to a cybership - many of these systems are linked and sharing assets - to overthrow one can overthrow many," he said. With agencies

item.title: Electricity cut affects Portugal, Spain and parts of southern France
item.description: A flaw of electricity affected, at 11:33 (18h33 in Macao), Portugal, Spain and some areas of southern France. In the first moments, information and speculation about the cause of the blackout were disseminated, namely in relation to a possible large-scale cyberataque, a hypothesis that was not excluded in the first instance by the General Secretariat of Internal Administration. Until the closing of this issue, the cause was not yet clear, nor was there an estimate for the return of electricity, but Prime Minister Luís Montenegro said he had hope that the light supply would be resumed yesterday, according to Lisbon time (7 less for Macau). However, there were news in Portuguese media that pointed to the return of electricity in various parts of the country, as well as in Spain. The Expresso newspaper cited data collected by the operators of the electricity network in the Iberian peninsula that pointed to tension imbalances as an explanation for the "blackout" rather than a cyberatheck designed to affect energy infrastructures. Until the closing of this edition, the Portuguese government did not rule out any explanation for the incident. The e-nodes warned that the forecast of electricity replacement remained indefinite and could be prolonged, without advance an estimate. "Given the problems of the network that persist the forecast of energy replacement remains undefined and may be prolonged," said the operator of the electricity distribution network in mainland Portugal, in a statement. E-Redes reiterated that the supply of electricity in Portugal was being affected by upstream constraints of the distribution network, in the very high voltage network in Spain. According to REN - national power grid, yesterday's blackout may have been caused by abnormal temperature fluctuations in Spain. The news was advanced by the BBC, which mentions an atmospheric phenomenon. Pandemonium scenario The incident caused chaos in the country. At airports, check-ins became manuals and began to be announced on flights at first, but were eventually canceled. TAP has issued a statement to appeal to passengers so as not to go to airports, as operation is temporarily conditioned due to blackout. Rail traffic was also totally interrupted throughout the Iberian Peninsula. In the hospitals, emergency generators and emergency services and surgeries have been prioritized to respond to urgent cases. In addition to the Emergency Meeting of the Council of Ministers, the National Operational Coordination Center, which is part of the entities in the context of protection and relief operations, gathered to follow the situation and adopt the necessary procedures due to the lack of energy in mainland Portugal. The telephone and computer systems of the National Institute of Emergency Medical was operating until the closing of this edition using generators and the fuel supply posts interrupted the services. On the other hand, the Águas de Portugal (ADP) group appealed to water consumption only for essential uses, “very moderate”, and said there were only “punctual failures”. Heard by Lusa regarding the widespread cutting of electricity and a possible water failure, the company's official source warned that there may be consumer constraints, although without advanced more concrete data. ADP, which brings together more than a dozen water suppliers on the continent, "appeals to the use of water for the essentials only." "ADP is following the situation in all companies," the source said. The company, he added, intends to ensure that essential services have water and recalled that reservoirs have water but it takes energy to transport it, and that even the buildings themselves need energy to get water to consumers taps.

Thus, "with a view to promoting the exchange with the outside, the automatic passage channels will also have foreigners, so that they deal with the input and exit inspection formalities through these channels." The measure, which allows the Portuguese to stay in China for tourism, business or traffic for a maximum of 15 days, in force at least until December 31, 2025. In the same month, Continental China had announced the expansion, from 90 to 180 days, from the permanence period for foreign residents of Macao on multiple entries in the country. The measure includes permanent and non-permanent foreign residents of Macao that move “to the interior of China for short-term tourism, trade, visit to family members, visits and other activities”. item.title: Employment | Leong Sun Iok warns of collecting candidate information
item.description:
Leong Sun IOK warns of the increase of companies that research the past of job candidates and argues that the information obtained by former employers is often skewed and unfair. The deputy calls for regulation to the government
Deputy Leong Sun IOK intends that the government regulates the collection of information carried out by companies about job candidates. The request is contained in a written interpellation, in which the legislator linked to the Federation of Macao Workers Associations (Faom) warns of the occurrence of various illegalities, without any consequences. According to the scenario outlined by Leong Sun Iok, when applying for a job, especially through online platforms, interested parties are led to sign forms and to consent that entities research their past. However, the deputy warns that the practice is illegitimate, uncommon, allowing the creation of informal black lists and the exchange of information between companies. This situation can result in the blocking of job opportunities for former employees who have had different employer entities. "It is a practice that blocks access to employment in an industry, which seriously undermines the right to employment," says the legislator. Leong Sun Iok also reveals that “over the years he has received a high number of requests and assistance” from people faced from one of the six game dealers and that they have later seen themselves. "Some people who asked me for help told me that they were convinced by supervisors to say goodbye. And if they did not say goodbye to their initiative, they were threatened that they would never find employment in the industry again. All these cases reflect the damage caused by collecting information without any regulation," added the deputy. However, the practice is not limited to this sector: "In addition to the game dealers, there are a high number of companies in Macao that also requires employment candidates to allow their past to be investigated," he said. Against the law Leong Sun IOK also points out that the Labor Relations Law and Decree-Law 101/84/M define that former expirers when issuing a proof of work to a former worker cannot make any unfavorable reference to its past. However, the deputy indicates that the current, even informal practice, contradicts the spirit of the law, ending up being more harmful, because the former employee has no control over information that may not even be true. "As the verification process lacks transparency and is not controlled by the Directorate of Services for Labor Affairs, it is unfair to employment candidates and can violate the principle of good faith in labor relations," he warns. "How will management regulate information about professional background? It is possible to issue guidelines and change the law to explicitly stipulate that former employers should in no way transmit, make statements or adopt unfavorable behaviors to workers?"

item.title: WONG KIT CHENG calls for more birth incentive measures
item.description: Deputy Wong Kit Cheng considers that the government should create complementary birth incentive measures beyond the childhood assistance allowance in the Governing Action Lines (LAG) for this year, and aims to grant 1,500 monthly patacas for children up to a maximum limit of three years of age. According to the citizen newspaper, Wong Kit Cheng believes that incentives for birth not only depend on financial support, but also on measures that take into account all the needs faced by local families. The deputy said that more efforts are needed in areas such as health, housing, education and social facilities to support couples with children. Given that, in their view, public departments do not have sufficient coordination with each other, their own department should be created to promote birth incentive policies permanently. Regarding the health area, the deputy, vice president of the Directorate of the General Union of Macao, advocates a greater specialization in pregnant care, namely at the level of a greater scope of examination of genetic diseases. Wong Kit Cheng calls for further advances in the level of pediatric health care and new measures regarding painless births. With regard to the free vaccination program, the deputy asks for more vaccines to be covered. Houses for all Another point highlighted by the deputy is the housing policy, which according to Wong Kit Cheng should respond to the needs of families in different phases, that is, from childhood to the growth of children. This said that the social and economic housing model has a punctuation system that gives families priority, but that the hypothesis of exchange of houses should be studied, so that families can change their housing depending on the number of children they have. For the legislator, there is also a need to review the planning of the leisure facilities for the youngest. The deputy stressed that the number of public facilities must be linked to the population density of each zone and the number of children resident.

item.title: Elections | PS again denounces alleged ATFPM practices
item.description:
The Macao Public Service Association is again accused by the Socialist Party to commit illegalities in the context of the vote of local voters for the next legislative elections in Portugal. Rita Santos and José Pereira Coutinho, from ATFPM, deny everything
The prosecution is not new: the Macao Public Function Workers Association (ATFPM) was the subject of a complaint made by the Socialist Party (PS) to the National Elections Commission (CNE) in Portugal, for making “actions that compromise the freedom and confidentiality of vote” of local voters for May 18, in Portugal, which will serve a new parliament and first minister. According to the PS complaint sent to the CNE, which includes photos of the alleged illegalities, "the presence of individuals who identify themselves as" volunteers "at the door of a Macao Post station, addressing voters to indicate where they should vote." Thus, “this is the same practice that occurred in the last legislative elections that took place in 2024 and it was found to be conducted by Rita Santos, a prominent figure of ATFPM and advisor to the Portuguese communities”. Rita Santos, however, stopped being a counselor. The images attached to the complaint show "one of the volunteers at the Macao postal door, addressing voters", and "in some cases requests the delivery of voting bulletins," a practice that suggests "directing the vote and calling into question the fundamental principles of a democratic electoral process." Scenario of “impunity” HM confronted Rita Santos and José Pereira Coutinho, president of ATFPM, with this complaint, both denied the accusations. "We are unaware of the situation of volunteers referring because ATFPM is not involved or interferes with the elections of the Assembly of the Republic of Portugal. This year are the elections of the Legislative Assembly (AL) of Macao and we are committed to the presentation of the candidacy of the Nova Esperança list," said Rita Santos. Pereira Coutinho, also deputy to Al, said “unaware of” the accusation. "ATFPM has no one to do this, they are inventions to which we are alien," he said. It is recalled that the last complaint submitted by the PS to the CNE was then sent to the prosecutor in Portugal. The investigation still takes place and is in secret of justice, as already reported, and no accusation has not yet been deducted. Already in 2019, the PS had submitted a similar complaint. The PS understands that "the constant action of the association in the electoral context raises concerns about the possible misuse of resources to influence the voting process", in the case of "recurring practices in potundous legislative elections". "The persistence of such behaviors, coupled with apparent impunity, aggravates the severity of the facts and requires, once and for all, a firm response from the competent authorities," the PS.

item.title: Administration | Ng wai han leaves from SAFP to drive dicj
item.description:
With the passage of Adriano Marques Ho to customs services, the direction of inspection and coordination of games began to be led interim by its sub-director Lio Chi Chong. The secretary for the economy and finances yesterday appointed NG Wai Han, the first woman at the head of the regulating entity of the Macao game

An order signed by the secretary for the economy and finance, Tai Kin IP, published yesterday in the official bulletin, names NG Wai Han as director of DICJ for a one year period. The NG Wai Han Service Commission began just yesterday with the publication of the order. It is recalled that the position had been vacant since Adriano Marques Ho was taken to the post of Customs Director General in December, during the reformulation of the holders of high public positions with the inauguration of the new Sam Hou Fai government. To the place of Adriano Marques Ho, who has directed Dicj since June 2020, the new executive appointed sub-director Lio Chi Chong. Ng Wai Han became the first woman in the leadership of the DICJ, after the exercise of Manuel das Neves, Paulo Martins Chan and Adriano Marques Ho. The rise of the former director of administration and civil service services to the top of the DICJ hierarchy marks a difference in the profile of leaders, which have so far come from the area of ​​security forces. WORK AND ADMINISTRATION The Secretary for Economics and Finance states that “NG Wai Han has professional competence and aptitude to exercise the position of director of the Directorate of Inspection and Game Coordination, which is demonstrated by Curriculum Vitae”. The new leader of the game regulatory entity in the territory is a law degree from the University of Sun Yat-Sen, where he also made a master's degree in Criminal Law. In 1999, he entered the civil service, to the position of Higher Technique (legal area) of the Directorate of Services for Labor Affairs (DSAL), where it remained until 2013. Between 2013 and 2016, headed the Divisions of Study of the Department of Studies and Informatics and Labor Rights Control of the Department of Labor Inspection. In May 2016, he began to lead the Labor Inspection Department and a year later was appointed subdirect, substitute of DSAL, and subdirecting until 2020, when it moved to the administration and civil service services after two decades in DSal. Between June 2020 and August 2023, Ng Wai Han was the subdirect of SAFP and a month later went to the SAFP, a position he held until yesterday.

item.title: Tour Guides | Government reduces fines due to the crisis
item.description: Tour guides who work without proper identification must be paid lower fines. This is the will of the government taking into account the new scenario to reduce the number of excursions. The matter was discussed in another meeting of the Permanent Commission of the Legislative Assembly (AL) that analyzes, in the specialty, the proposal of the activity of travel agencies and profession of tourist guide. At the meeting, which took place on Tuesday, Deputy Chan Chak Mo, who chairs the commission, explained that the government determined a significant reduction in the amount of the fine in case of offense after hearing the sector's opinions. At question is the fact that the content of the bill was prepared before the pandemic, but the Covid-19 years have changed the tourism landscape, with fewer excursions in Macao, which led to a crisis scenario. Thus, if the initial fine proposal focused between 10 and 20 thousand patacas, the new proposal goes down the penalty for values ​​between 2 and 10 thousand patacas. In addition, at Tuesday's meeting, it was also referred to by government representatives that a warning mechanism will be created for guides who make the first offense, namely when they do not show the licensing card of the activity.

item.title: Manifestation contained
item.description: During the “golden week” on May 1st (Labor Day), the city center of Macao was flooded by a crowd, however, the environment was contradictory and the Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) continue to fight for survival. In the first quarter of 2025 the global unemployment rate (1.9 percent) and the unemployment rate of the residents (2.5 percent) increased 0.2 percentage points, compared to the indicators of the fourth quarter of 2024. These numbers indicate that Macau's labor market is impacting economic recession and the influx of foreign workers. The numerous stores that closed in residential areas clearly reflect economic desolation. Although the “large award for consumption in community zones 2025” seems to function as a temporary accelerator, it does not attack the root of the problem. There is social discontent in relation to the administration of the Government of MSAR, however, on May 1st, except for the situation of a citizen who was taken by the police to be investigated in the prosecutor for protesting without warning the direction of services to Labor Affairs (DSAL), no demonstrations or protests were registered. As the public complaints accumulate, the social atmosphere has become visibly silent. And is that good or bad? The media revealed that the “Power of the People” group had notified the Public Security Police Corps (CPSP) of its intention to organize a protest manifestation on May 1, according to the provisions of the “Law of Meeting and Manifestation” Law. Police officers “express their concern repeatedly, promoting several meetings with group members to analyze the situation and take the necessary measures” as well as “warning them of the various possibilities in the face of“ uncontrollable situations ”that would lead them to take on“ joint and and several liability ”or, otherwise, risk the“ law relating to the defense of the state's security ”. They felt the weight of the invisible pressure and reluctantly chose to present a letter where they exposed their views to DSal. An article from another newspaper praised CPSP for the way he dealt with this case. He claimed that CPSP had significantly perfected its ability to disable “the Protest planned for May 1st”, and believed that CPSP, which supervises protests and manifestations according to the law, had adopted a “pros and cons” approach to neutralizing a mildly inflamed protest, eliminating possible social disturbances that came. On the one hand, the CPSP totally respected the rights of residents to protest and to express themselves and did not explicitly reject the notification presented by the group “Power of the People”. On the other hand, CPSP used persuasion to convince the group to cancel the “May 1 protest”. Some people become condescending and think that the city gets more peaceful without protests or manifestations, and this thought is the one that worries me the most. Someone with a minimum of common sense will understand that the accumulation of social discontent is not a motivating force, but a destructive force. The promulgation of the “Right of Meeting and Manifestation Law” has been intended to safeguard residents' freedom to manifest and protest, as guaranteed by the Macao Basic Law, not to ban them. In the past, the Government of MSAR effectively communicated with the protest and demonstrations organizers and coordinated these events very well. Unfortunately, in recent years, authorities have been very nervous or guided by their own priorities; and often excite the subjects and rush to us to the level of national security. If a slight cough is condemned to cause a highly contagious and fatal virus, a lot of labor is wasted and many resources, and the vitality of society is suffocated! A forest without any sound is terrifying and a silent river is full of murderous omens. A society cannot survive without any noise.

item.title: Artificial Intelligence on Sex in Macau
item.description: I had the experience of asking the most popular artificial intelligence platform that themes about sex, sexuality and gender would make sense to discuss in Macau. The answer brought three proposals that, although not very surprising, I found it interesting. Of course the platform used some creative and intellectual freedom - which I didn't ask for - to invent sources, quotes and points of view. Basically, he went to seek what is already known about Taiwan and Hong Kong, about the growing opening to LGBTQI+themes, and tried to make parallels with Macao. He mentioned the rainbow of Macau/澳門彩虹/Rainbow of Macau as the most active association in defending LGBTQI+ rights in the territory, and even invented interviews with its founder, with fictional quotes. The first proposal that artificial intelligence suggested is about Macao young people and their opening to non-binary and plural gender identities as a way of navigating western and oriental cultural identities, and monitoring generational changes. Worldwide we have seen an emancipation movement in this area, with many young people to discuss these issues openly. If in some countries institutions and policies follow these changes (and in others until retreat), in Macao the pit may be higher, taking into account its geographical situation. I went looking for studies that deepened the subject and found one who asked young people from Macau between 18 and 25 years old. The authors have analyzed how adherence to polyculturalism, the idea that crops are interconnected and influence each other, associated with lower levels of sexual prejudice, including negative attitudes towards LGBTQ+people. The study suggests that the cultural diversity of Macao, and the belief that cultures mingle, can create a predisposition to also accept sexual diversity. But I would say that it is still necessary to explore more about these issues, listening to real testimonies about the experiences of young people living in Macao. The second proposal - which I have mentioned here without account - has to do with the lack of accessible, inclusive and focused sex education, promoting more knowledge and pleasure in Macao and worldwide. If a few months ago I gave the example of Hong Kong, where it was suggested to play Badminton as a way to manage sexual abstinence, I would say that Macau is not much more open to talking about sex than that. This lack of discussion creates a series of complications that, due to the absence of data in the region, do not even know the true dimension of the problem. The absence of comprehensive and inclusive sex education increases the risk of sexual violence, discrimination and propagation of sexually transmitted infections. The third proposal surprised me, because it is a theme in which I rarely think: the growth of LGBTQia+ tourism in Asia and the opportunity that Macau has to bet on this niche. Since the hotel industry is the pillar of the economy of Macao, it would make sense to embrace this opportunity, as they have already made Thailand and Taiwan, creating LGBTQIA+spaces, or with specific events, such as Pride Month celebrations. According to some data produced online, this type of tourism is profitable and growing. Artificial intelligence even has interesting ideas, although something generic. But I confess that I was pleased to realize that the algorithm is in tune to defend the rights of sexual minorities and has an inclusive discourse. It becomes dangerous, however, when it begins to invent data and information just so that the argument sounds good. Still, in general, it can be a useful tool for discussing these issues without judgment. As the platform itself says, it has the potential to “combat myths, spread ethical concepts and include perspectives of marginalized groups, democratizing access to more complete and positive sex education.” In this suggestion of content creation, it seemed aligned with these values. If you will ever replace the work of people like me, who write on these topics, or the work of sexual educators… maybe it's too early to draw conclusions. Sensitive and thinking people still have a lot to contribute.

item.title: Saint Valentine's Day in the Czech Republic
item.description: In Macao, many people know that May 1st is Labor Day and is an official holiday. The same takes place in mainland China, marking May 1st the beginning of a long holiday. However, few know that in the Republic checked May 1st is the "Day of St. Valentine". On Valentine's Day, Czech lovers follow tradition and kiss under the cherry trees, singing songs to love. And the kiss why? According to Czech folklore, if a girl is not kissed under a cherry tree on St. Valentine's day, she will "wither" next year, losing "youth and charm." Therefore, a kiss means "protection and blessings." And what is “protection in love”? In mid -2015, Sean Lau, the winner of the Hong Kong's best actor's best actor award for his work in the movie “Overheard 3”, presented the “Space Nave Theory”. He used a simple phrase to show how his wife Amy Kwok protected him: “When I enter a spaceship and travel anywhere in the universe, you always find a way to bring me back to Earth safely.” The meaning of this phrase is simple and clear. If you are where you are, face what to face, you always bring me back safely. You are always by my side, making me be loved, hot, happy and in peace. Apart from the “spacecraft theory”, there is another sean Lau phrase that is part of the “passionate quotes for my wife”: "One day you no longer want to love love, you just want someone who doesn't leave you." Does true love require two people to stay together? In March 2025, news was released in Taiwan, China, saying that a woman had published an online article, where she said she had a boyfriend six years ago, but eventually found out that he was getting married to another. And this happened because her boyfriend loved her so much and didn't want her to go through the suffering caused by her relationship with her mother-in-law, so she decided to marry a woman from whom her parents liked, but he didn't like and assured his girlfriend that his "relationship" would not be affected. After marrying another woman, she would date forever with her beloved. Love implies "protection and blessings." Is it in favor of the “spacecraft theory” or “Nora/mother -in -law theory”? What are "blessings"? In Taiwan, China, the host of the television program “Yu Meiren”, (Yu Yunjie) had no contact with her in -laws for a long time. Once went to court due to a disagreement between mother and husband. Finally, the judge stated that his 16 -year marriage had come to an end. Later, Yu Meiren has lost a lot of weight, but now it is more beautiful than before and at his disposal has changed. She stated: "The French believe that in love we should accept those who come and we should not retain those who want to leave. 'When love happens, we must be ourselves, follow our hearts and act without schemes. When love is over, we must respect the other and not try to arrest or force it, which means that" letting out is the best of blessings. " Do you agree with the phrase “letting go is the best of blessings, the blessing is the best relief”? Hong Kong Cine Cine Cine Cenilia Cheung once expressed some disappointment after the divorce: "In love there is only one thing that can hurt us, it is the unwillingness. When we cannot live with ourselves, we inflicted pain." Perhaps that “protection and blessings” have different meanings for each person, but for me, "I have to say this only once. After all these years, I still love you." item.title: Rui Cunha Foundation hosts “polyphony” until next week
item.description: The Rui Cunha Foundation (FRC) hosts until Saturday next week, the 17th, the collective exhibition “Polyfonia”, with works by artist Gu Yue and six doctoral students from the Faculty of Humanities and Arts of the University of Science and Technology of Macao (Must), co-organizer of the event. The project makes known 20 works that represent the forms and styles of renowned artist and professor Gu Yue and his disciples Luo Su, Zhu Zhaohui, Wang Kongbin, Ding Song, Guo Weiwei, and Wei Dongsheng. According to a FRC note, this exhibition presents “a visual banquet that transcends tradition and contemporaneity, the material and digital, the place and the global, through the collision of various media and the resonance of ideas”. The works include various art forms, “such as installations, oil paintings, lacquer paintings, sand paintings and details to detail brush, displaying Macau's unique artistic ecosystem as a cultural convergence point”, is referred to. The name of the exhibition originates “in musical terminology, referring to the opposition and symbiosis of multiple voices”. The presentation of the show states that "the mission of art is to create cognitive disorientation", and "through the confrontation between traditional crafts and the new media, and the rapport of local cultural genes and global issues, it breaks the linear narrative and invites the audience to calibrate their cognition in the" glow between brightness and residual shadow. " Joint work Professor Gu Yue aligns his work and the investigation with the main theme of the exhibition. The creations of the six doctoral students "start from individual experiences and respond to propositions such as identity, time and memory in the age of digital capital, also forming a multi-wing resonance of thought." Exhibition is not only a concentrated exhibition of academic achievements, but also a speculative experience on the essence of art. “In this culturally stratified place of Macao, polyphony tries to use art as a prism to reflect the symbiotic possibilities of multiple realities,” describes the team, cited by the same note.

item.title: AFA | “Déjà Vu” presents works in the area of ​​Video-Arte
item.description:
Integrated in the poster of this year's edition of the French May festival, here is the new exhibition of the local AFA - Art for All Society Association. This is “Déjà VU-an exhibition of Sino-Francês artistic exchange”, where the themes of video art and artificial intelligence resonate from the signing works of Robert Cahen, Alice Kok and Catherine Cheong. To see in The Parisian between May 15 and June 28
Video art, mixed with the real and the fictional, artificial and created with human hands. It is around these ideas and concepts that revolves the new exhibition of AFA-Art for All Society, entitled “Dejá Vu-an exhibition of sino-francês artistic exchange”, and which gains the subtitle “Mirroring ・ Loging ・ Generatting”: from video art to artificial intelligence-exhibition series ”. The project, patent between May 15 and June 28 in one of the galleries of The Parisian venture in Cotai, presents to the public works of three artists: Alice Kok, co-founder of AFA, artist and curator; Robert Cahen and Catherine Cheong. The project is integrated in this year's edition poster of the French May festival, which brings Hong Kong a series of cultural initiatives. According to a statement from AFA, “Déjà vu” aims to establish “a bridge between the Sino-Franceses cultural dialogues through art”, also promoting the investigation into “the philosophical intersections of time, memory and perception”. In addition to the presence in Macao, this show will be evident in France, between 21 and 30 August, at the Espace Temps Gallery in Paris. Thus, the “cultural exchange” is promoted between China and France, highlights AFA, and the public is invited to “witness the evolution of interaction between memory and technology”. “Déjà vu”, theory developed by the French philosopher Henri Bergson, gives the motto to this show, revealing “the simultaneous division between perception and memory”, that is, “the coexistence between the present 'current' and its 'virtual' image in the mirror”. The works of the three artists thus exploit this abstract philosophical concept, transforming it into “tangible sensory experiences through video art, images generated by artificial intelligence and multimedia facilities”. The show, which has the keywords “Mirroring”, “looping” and “Generation”, referring to the ideas of mirror, repetition or content generation, reflects “not only the artists techniques, but also metaphorizes the way memory and technology weave the invisible tissue of contemporary reality”. Initial Workshop In addition to the show itself, artists will also join to teach others about the world of digital and video art. Robert Cahen, considered one of the pioneers in Video Art in France, collaborates with Alice Kok for the “Video Postcards” workshop, held on May 18 The Parisian Macau. The idea is to lead participants to “dive into Coloane's natural and historical landscapes, inspired by the poetics of fleeting images', characteristic of Cahen's work”. Thus, “through techniques such as slow chamber, overlap and sound design, participants will transform ephemeral sensory experiences into unique '' postcards,” describes AFA, and experience includes filming, post-production context and final projection. Who is who Robert Cahen has been developing artistic projects since 1972. According to the official program of the French May festival, in Cahen's work “both fiction and documentation are presented as metaphorical trips of the imaginary, exquisite daydreams that describe passages of time, place, memory and perception”. Having started with the video cassettes, his works were exposed worldwide, in places and events such as the Paris Biennial, France; The Museum of Modern Art (MoMA), New York, USA; or the American Film Institute National Video Festival, Los Angeles, USA. In 1992 the artist won the Villa Medicis Hors Les Murs award and, in 1995, created a permanent video installation for Euralille (Lille) public space in France. In the case of Catherine Cheong, she is a local artist who lives between Macau and Paris, having graduated in the area of ​​video installation at the Visual Arts Degree at École Supérieure D'Art et de Design Toulon. In addition, the artist graduated in personal creation and contemporary engraving theory with a master's degree in visual arts at the University of Paris VIII. “As an individual artist, his inspiration comes from personal experience. Through cultural differences, contradictions and interactions between human beings, the social environment and nature, explores the realization of life and the feelings of the soul. It goes back, juxtaposes and doubles symbolic images to recreate new meanings, seeking coincidence between images with different artistic languages ​​and means to express feelings, thoughts and personal desires”, can be read in the “FRench program”. May ”.

item.title: Ka Hó | “Hold on to Hope” gallery welcomes “our time zone”
item.description: The “Hold on To Hope” gallery, managed by the Macao Toxicode Rehabilitation Association (ArtM) at the settlement of Ka-Hó, in Coloane, has a new show, entitled “Our Time Zone-Collective Art Exhibition and Curative Calligraphy” with works by artists Kinki Wong and Belinda Chim. The exhibition is organized by the Macau Hope Painting Association and, according to words by Kinki Wong, who collaborates not only as an artist, but also as a curator, "was born of the idea that everyone experiences moments of ups and downs, uncertainty and confusion." Thus, for the artist, “Our Time Zone”, focused on artwork and handwriting, intends to “use sensory interaction to express art theories of art therapy, fostering a different interaction between art, culture and exposure”. Keeping in mind that “art reflects the body”, “Our Time Zone” promotes “the awareness of the local community for mental health” in order to “understand one's own body through art therapy”. Kinki Wong is a native of Macau and has been working as an expressive art therapist, having a master's degree in this area and specialization in Psychology from European Graduate School in Switzerland. Already Belinda Chim has done western handwriting since he went to Australia to study design. Having over ten years of experience in this art, Belinda stands out in the creation of works with animal themes, using expressive lines within Western handwriting. The artist has already held exhibitions and face -to -face courses in Hong Kong, Japan and Malaysia, having taught more than four thousand people in the area of ​​handwriting. The show can be visited until May 25th.

item.title: Saint Lazarus | NG I Weng exhibition to see by the end of the month

item.title: MGM Resorts International warns bets in Japan and Thailand
item.description: A Casinos operator in Macau said yesterday that the opening of casinos in Japan and the potential legalization of the game in Thailand will increase competition with regard to Asian gamblers. The director for the global development of the US company MGM Resorts International, which operates two casinos in Macao, said the new game concessions accelerated the transition from a model based on major gamblers to “a more diverse tourism and entertainment economy”. The six Macao game operators signed 10-year concession agreements in December 2022, committing to invest 108.7 billion in tourism and the diversification of the economy. “The reinforcement of cultural attractions, from entertainment to families (…) helped attract more vast demographics than traditional gamblers,” said Ed Bowers. But the executive warned that "competition is intensifying in Asian markets, particularly with Japan and potentially Thailand." MGM started on April 24 with the construction of the first integrated venture with a Japan casino in Osaka, scheduled for 2030. The Thailand government presented a proposal to legalize the game. "This is excellent news for staff of the development of casinos like me," said Bowers, who recalled that Thailand "already benefits from a strong tourist infrastructure." But the discussion of the proposal in Parliament was postponed in early April, "probably due to the increase in political opposition" to the idea, admitted the executive. Other bets Bowers spoke during the Global Gaming Expo Asia, the largest event in the game industry held in Macau, which will take place until Friday. In another session of the same event, experts argued that, given the greater regional competition, the bet on game -related attractions, such as concerts, themed parks and gastronomy can bring more people to the casinos. “We built all this to support our casino, the casino is our financial engine,” said Wade Howk, director of operations at Inspire Entertainment Resort, an integrated resort in South Korea, with an exclusive casino for foreigners. The session focused on the diversification of the economy of Macao, where taxes on casinos represented 88.4 percent of the region's current current revenues in the first three months of the year. As an example, Wade Howk stressed that Inspire Entertainment built a 15,000 -seat entertainment space, the only multipurpose cultural arena in South Korea to increase the number of visitors. "We are seeing huge results with this now, and then we built a covered water park ... just to make sure we could boost traffic to support the entire property, ... and that it could be used to support the casino," Howk explained. item.title: Health | Services warn of “more active” chickenpox viruses
item.description:
The government yesterday launched an alert to the increase of costumes of chickenpox in Macao. Since the beginning of the year, authorities have reported 195 cases of infection, almost double the same period of 2024. About three quarters of infections are contracted by children
Macao's varicella virus is becoming more active, health services have indicated yesterday, appealing to parents, educational institutions, and day care centers to be aware of symptoms and adopt a preventive stance. According to data on communicable declaration diseases, authorities found that last week there was a “trend to increase the number of varicella cases, with the weekly average of 12 cases from April 6 to rise to 23 last week”. The body led by Alvis Lo points out that "this number is higher than that of last year's same -year period (10 cases)." Authorities also account for a case of collective chickenpox infection that was recently detected at Pui Ching Secondary School, affecting a total of 21 students. From May 1, students "had symptoms of rash and small bubbles on the head, face, limbs, back and chest, having undergone medical treatment." Authorities add that there were no serious complications and that "most patients were vaccinated with a dose of chickenpox." From the beginning Between January 1 and May 6 this year, 195 cases of chickenpox were recorded in Macao, a number that almost doubled infections during last year's same year, when 105 cases were registered. About three quarters of cases concern children, most ages between 8 and 17 years old, representing 65.1 percent of the total, while people aged 7 or under or less represent only 6.1 percent of the total. Health services highlight that since the beginning of the year there has been no record of serious or deadly cases. Authorities add that part of the inoculated population against the chickenpox is still likely to be affected by what health professionals call disruptive infection. However, "symptoms are usually slight and atypical, with fewer bubbles and the duration of the disease is relatively short." According to the government, the cases of chickenpox at Pui Ching secondary school are disruptive infections.
